intro: Brittonrosea wippermannii, commonly known as the Wippermann's Brittonrose, is a rare and specialized flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its showy, single flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open, sunny habitats. Its foliage consists of simple, alternate leaves with a serrated margin. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species in conservation efforts.
